past simple and past participle of
bake
A2 [ I or T ] to cook inside an oven, without using added liquid or fat: I made the icing while the cake was baking. a baked potato freshly baked bread Bake at 180°C for about 20 minutes. Bake for 5–7 minutes in a preheated oven. a baking dishUK a baking tin/trayUS a baking sheet/pan
[ I or T ] to make something such as earth or clay hard by heating it, usually in order to make bricks
[ I ] informal to be or become very hot: It's baking outside. You'll bake in that fleece jacket!
